intro: Erodium malacoides f. subangulatum, commonly known as the angular erodium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has slender, angular stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
